      Subclasses of TextPattern in nl.inl.blacklab.search.textpattern 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  TextPatternAnd
      AND operation.
      class  TextPatternAndNot
      AND (NOT) query for combining different annotations from an annotated field.
      class  TextPatternAnnotation
      TextPattern for wrapping another TextPattern so that it applies to a certain annotation on an annotated field.
      class  TextPatternAnyToken
      A 'gap' of a number of tokens we don't care about, with minimum and maximum length.
      class  TextPatternCaptureGroup
      TextPattern for capturing a subclause as a named "group".
      class  TextPatternCombiner
      Abstract base class for combining several text patterns into a single new compound TextPattern
      class  TextPatternConstrained 
      class  TextPatternEdge
      Returns either the left edge or right edge of the specified query.
      class  TextPatternExpansion 
      class  TextPatternFilterNGrams 
      class  TextPatternFuzzy
      A TextPattern matching a word with fuzzy matching.
      class  TextPatternNot
      NOT operator for TextPattern queries at token and sequence level.
      class  TextPatternOr
      A TextPattern matching at least one of its child clauses.
      class  TextPatternPositionFilter
      A TextPattern searching for TextPatterns that contain a hit from another TextPattern.
      class  TextPatternPrefix
      A TextPattern matching words that start with the specified prefix.
      class  TextPatternRegex
      A TextPattern matching a regular expression.
      class  TextPatternRepetition
      Repetition of a pattern.
      class  TextPatternSensitive
      TextPattern for wrapping another TextPattern so that it applies to a certain word annotation.
      class  TextPatternSequence
      A sequence of patterns.
      class  TextPatternTags
      A TextPattern matching a word.
      class  TextPatternTerm
      A TextPattern matching a word.
      class  TextPatternWildcard
      A textpattern matching a simple wildcard expression.
